alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:52PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Beaver, eastern Texas, Lipscomb, northern Roberts, northern Hemphill and Ochiltree Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 351 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over the eastern Oklahoma Panhandle and the northeast Texas Panhandle, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Perryton, Lipscomb, Canadian, Beaver, Booker, Forgan, Follett, Higgins, Darrouzett, Gate, Knowles, Wolf Creek Park, Elmwood, Farnsworth, Boyd, Floris, Glazier, Lake Marvin, Bryans Corner and Mocane. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
